It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in a head. Koanophyllon dolicholepis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
